content:
WebServiceInputActivity Class

Definition

Enables receiving data from a Web service in a workflow. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

The WebServiceInputActivity corresponds to a Web service method when the containing workflow is deployed as a Web service. When the workflow Web service is called, the WebServiceInputActivity receives data.

Initializes a new instance of the WebServiceInputActivity class.

Attributes

IsActivatingProperty

Represents the DependencyProperty that targets the stem.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.IsActivating* property.

public static readonly System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty IsActivatingProperty;
Attributes
DefaultEventAttribute DesignerAttribute ToolboxBitmapAttribute ObsoleteAttribute ActivityCodeGeneratorAttribute ActivityValidatorAttribute

Remarks

The IsActivating property should be set to true for only the very first WebServiceInputActivity. This signals to the workflow runtime that invoking this Web service method from a client starts the execution of the workflow. The first activity of a workflow definition that is exposed as a Web service is of type WebServiceInputActivity and sets this property to true. You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property. This dependency property is the public static field named XProperty or XEvent, where X is the corresponding property.

RolesProperty

Identifies the valid user roles that are allowed to send messages from the Web service client to the WebServiceInputActivity. The two types of supported roles are Active Directory and ASP.NET.

public static readonly System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty RolesProperty;

Properties

InterfaceType

Gets or sets the interface type that defines the method that this activity listens on.

public Type InterfaceType { get; set; }
Value
Type

The interface type.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute EditorAttribute RefreshPropertiesAttribute TypeFilterProviderAttribute

IsActivating

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether receiving data should start the workflow.

public bool IsActivating { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if receiving data should start the workflow; otherwise, false.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute MergablePropertyAttribute

Remarks

Only the first receive in a workflow can have the IsActivating property set to true. If more than one IsActivating is set to true, the session is locked on the first request. This lasts as long as the other receive blocks the workflow; the session is deadlocked.

MethodName

Gets or sets the name of the method on the interface specified by the stem.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.InterfaceType* property that this WebServiceInputActivity represents.

public string MethodName { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the method on the interface specified by the stem.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.InterfaceType* property that this WebServiceInputActivity represents.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute MergablePropertyAttribute RefreshPropertiesAttribute TypeConverterAttribute

ParameterBindings

Gets the collection of bindings associated with the input parameters to the method specified in the stem.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.MethodName* property.

public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowParameterBindingCollection ParameterBindings { get; }
Value
WorkflowParameterBindingCollection

The collection of properties used as inbound parameters on the method specified by the stem.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.MethodName* property.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute

Remarks

ParameterBindings on a WebServiceInputActivity are used to bind the inbound parameters to locations in the workflow. When the WebServiceInputActivity executes, the bound locations are set to the values of the corresponding inbound parameters.

Roles

Gets or sets a collection of roles that are valid to send data to the WebServiceInputActivity.

public System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRoleCollection Roles { get; set; }
Value
WorkflowRoleCollection

The WorkflowRoleCollection that contains the Web service roles that are valid to send data to the WebServiceInputActivity.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute EditorAttribute

Remarks

Security access exceptions are thrown if the Web service receives a request from a non-member of the Roles collection.

The default value is an empty collection, which gives open access to the Web service.
